pkcs11Subtitle.message: If you have certificates stored in a crypto device and want to use them via PKCS#11, mark one of the options below.

pkcs11CustomSubtitle.message: If your crypto device is not listed above, enter the name of the {{lib-ext}} file given by the manufacturer

experimentalAccessDetails.message: Gain early access to features still under development.

noTrustedSites.message: Here you'll be able to review and manage the websites that you authorized to perform digital signatures (for now there are none).

trustedSitesSubtitle.message: The following websites are authorized to perform digital signatures using the certificates below

notInstalledTitle.message: Web PKI is not fully installed

notInstalledMessage.message: In order to use this component, you must also install the Web PKI native component on your PC

outdatedMessage.message: There is an available update for Web PKI native component on your PC

downloadedMessagePart3.message: to update Web PKI on your PC

redownloadMessageLinux.message: If something went wrong, choose a package to download again:

redownloadMessageLinuxDeb.message: Package .deb for Debian-based distributions (e.g. Ubuntu, Mint):

redownloadMessageLinuxRpm.message: Package .rpm for RedHat- and Slackware-based distributions (e.g. Fedora, openSUSE):

confirmRemoveCertificateMessagePart1.message: Are you sure you want to remove the certificate

confirmRemoveDeviceMessage.message: Are you sure you want to remove the device

welcomeMessage.message: In order to start using Web PKI, you must import a PKCS #12 (PFX) certificate or enable the use of a cryptographic device.

aboutDescription.message: Web PKI is a Web based component that supports documents digital signing and general digital certificate operations without the need of Java.

noDevice.message: No device connected. Click the 'Add' button to add a new device.

syncDevice1.message: Open the Web PKI app on your mobile

syncDevice3.message: Point your mobile to the code below

mobileTimeout.message: The mobile {{deviceName}} is not responding. Please make sure the Web PKI app is opened in the mobile and refresh the device pairing in the browser plugin option 'Mobiles'.

mobileConnectTimeout.message: Could not connect to mobile {{deviceName}}. Please refresh the device pairing in the browser plugin option 'Mobiles'.

mobileNotAuthorized.message: This computer is no longer authorized for connecting to {{deviceName}}. Please refresh or remove the pairing in the browser plugin option 'Mobiles'.

mobileSendMessage.message: Could not send the command to mobile {{deviceName}}. Please make sure this computer is allowed in the 'Computers' menu option on Web PKI app and refresh the device pairing in the browser plugin option 'Mobiles'.
